thread.title: 10 ways LSU is welcoming South Carolina: What South Carolina media are saying
thread.title_full: 10 ways LSU is welcoming South Carolina: What South Carolina media are saying | NOLA.com

author: Jim Kleinpeter, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: 10 ways LSU is welcoming South Carolina: What South Carolina media are saying
text:
LSU is not painting the Tiger Stadium field garnett and black but Baton Rouge is rolling out the red carpet in many other ways for the Gamecocks, who moved their game to Baton Rouge because of severe flooding.
The State's Josh Kendal counts 10 ways LSU is making South Carolina feel at home . David Cloninger said LSU fans are living up to their reputation for hospitality.
Kendall also confirms that Perry Orth will start at quarterback for the Gamecocks .
Matt Connolly writes that Steve Spurrier suspects Missouri knew his plays last week. Here's a game day guide from the South Carolina perspective .
Steve Spurrier is 15th on the highest paid coach list , writes Charleston Post and Courier's Aaron Brenner.
David Caraviello said the Gamecocks are trying to keep the focus on football .
Geaux Gamecocks: 10 ways LSU is making USC feel at home http://t.co/kdieh9Bhx4 #thestate #gg pic.twitter.com/MwyzBlDnrQ
